snippet: The social network, blocked in China since 2009, has developed software to keep posts from appearing in users’ news feeds in specific geographic areas, current and former employees said....
abstract: Facebook has quietly developed software that prevents posts from appearing in user news feeds in specific geographic areas, as part of effort to make inroads in China, where social network has been blocked since 2009; software, which Facebook would offer to enable third party in China to monitor and possible censor popular stories and topics, indicates site may be willing to compromise its stated mission to 'make world more open and connected' in order to access country's lucrative market.

byline.contributor: Paul Mozur contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: The social network, blocked in China since 2009, has developed software to keep posts from appearing in users’ news feeds in specific geographic areas, current and former employees said.

headline.main: Facebook Said to Create Censorship Tool to Get Back Into China
headline.print_headline: For Facebook, Censorship Tool Could Reopen a Door to China
